moves.2. Bc4: here I get the feeling he's going for something like a fools mate or get his knight to fork the queen/rook playing at GK made me more aware of this and am always suspicious after this move
moves.2... Nc6: I continue normal just getting my pieces out
moves.3. c3: ? never saw that before but not to odd since I am not realy high rated...
moves.3... Nf6 4. d3 Bc5: just taking out more pieces while he is taking out his pawns was still confused but now I realise he might have tried to build a pawn wall
moves.5. h3 O-O 6. Nf3 d6 7. Nbd2 Na5: I know it is a bit weird to do this but I realy wanted that bishop for my knight since I was hoping for a more open game later on
moves.10. Ncxe5 Bd6 11. Qc2: he goes into defense while I keeping pressure on all his pieces
moves.11... Qe8 12. Bf4 b6 13. O-O Bb7: keeping pressure on his E pawn seeing as he is defending it with his queen
moves.14. Rfe1 d4: going for a exchange hoping to give my bishop a better rpossition while also making an attack on his rook
moves.15. cxd4 Bxb4 16. Re2 Rc8: I realis that the ABC column is pretty open hoping to get my pawns in a better possition
moves.17. Qb3 c5: basicly a win win if he passes I get to keep my pawn structure if he takes I can recapture with my bishop to lign up to his king
moves.18. d5 Ba6: gain more strenght at the C4 for a attack on the queen with pawn or bishop afterwards
moves.19. Nc4: did not see that one comming
moves.19... Bxc4: hoping he would take it with the pawn so I could move my knight in
moves.20... b5: another attack on the queen while advancing my pawns
moves.21. Qb3 a5 22. Qd1 c4 23. Ne1: a bit odd but I can't forfeit the pawns now and if he get's a knight in he might be able to fork I miss those more often then I should so I'd rather get him out of the way
moves.23... Bxe1 24. Rxe1 c3: fatal mistake I should have noticed my cramped rook unfortunatly I did not
moves.25. Rc1: I guess he missed it to as im still ocupied with my pawns I still didn't notice it
moves.25... b4 26. Bd6: now I have to make the most out of this iether I have to get a rook back soon or im done
moves.26... Qb5: getting my queen involved in the pawns was at the time my best bet
moves.27. Bxf8 Rxf8: I think this mistake was the fatal one you will see why
moves.28. Qb3: he touched his queen to early here and was forced to move it imo he could have just left it there im not realy uptight about it but he tought differently
moves.28... Qxd3: I grab the oppertunity I did not know yet that it was an accident(he told me after)
moves.29. Rcd1 Qb5 30. a4 Qc5 31. d6: if I still had my rook on the C file I could have gone for a exchange in my fafour wich would cripple his attack but unfortunatly I didn't so I still tried to rectify that mistake wich only made things worse
moves.31... Rc8 32. d7: at this point I didn't see any other option then taking the pawn or lose my last rook it is a lost cause anyway
moves.32... Nxd7 33. Rxd7: this is where my notation ends but from memory the last moves where this there realy wasn't much I could do anymore
moves.33... c2 34. Qxf7+ Kh8 35. Qxg7#: thank you all for watching I believe this is the first game I annotated I made some small comments in other but not as elaborate as this... please any advice is welcome don't go soft on me:)
